question: Which parts of a non-Zabiha animal are considered pure?
answer:
QUESTION
ANSWER


Share:
a) Feathers, b) Beak, c) Bone, d) Milk, e) Eggs, f) Hooves. (Bahr al-Raaiq vol.1 pg.106; Rasheed Trust). The byproducts of such parts will be pure even if the animal is not slaughtered according to the Islamic Laws of Zabah. (Ibid)

Al-Mahmood 18
